page.title: 19THE FALCONRY CENTRE-NEWENT
page.content: The{Birds of Prey Conservation and {Falconry Centre,}was opened at {Cliffords Mesne}in 1967 by Philp Glasier, the Falconer. The centre now leads the world in the captive breeding of the{Raptors (Birds {of Prey>}and has recently embarked on a programme of releasing birds to the wild- notably the{Barn Owl.}Pairs of birds of endagered species are also sent to the centre from all over the world and when a successful breeding programme is established the off- spring are again returned to their place of origin. Some{45000 visitors}a year are able to see Owls,Falcons,Eagles,Buzzards, Kites and Vultures to name but a few. There is also a museum with exhibits and photographs but the highlight of any visit must be the free-flying demonstrations by the birds of prey.
